newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Kookmin Bank to set HK$1 bln FRN.
newsitem.headline: Kookmin Bank to set HK$1 bln FRN.

text.p: Terms have been set for Kookmin Bank's upcoming Hong Kong dollar floating rate note issue, bankers said on Wednesday.
The issue will be HK$1 billion in size and have a final maturity of three years. There are no put or call options.
Merrill Lynch and Sakura Finance Asia have been mandated to arrange the issue.
The notes will be priced at par to float at 40 basis points over the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
Fees for the bond-style issue are 30 basis points, split as 15 basis points for management and underwriting and 15 basis points for selling.
No application will be made to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority to accept the notes for use at its Liquidity Adjustment Facility (LAF), or discount window.
Kookmin Bank is not eligible for the facililty because it does not have a branch in Hong Kong, bankers said.
Eligibility for LAF makes an issue more attractive to banks because holders of the qualifying debt can engage in repurchase agreements with the Monetary Authority, increasing liquidity.
